column2: NEW HAMPSHIRE PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column6: NH

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column6: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only
column10: Stay on the main highway if possible

column2: 2. To avoid the risk of being involved in an alcohol-related crash, you should:
column4: decide before you start drinking that you are not going to drive.
column6: call a taxi if you've been drinking.
column8: say “No, thanks" if someone offers you alcohol.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column6: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column10: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column6: The road ends ahead

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column6: Keep right, traffic is entering from another road.

column2: 6. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column6: BEFORE you move.
column10: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column6: No right turn

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.
column6: Shopping centre ahead.
column8: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column10: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.

column2: 9. This sign means:
column6: You may make a U-turn.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column6: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way
column10: You must come to a complete stop

column2: 11. This road sign means:
column6: Merge
column8: You must come to a complete stop
column10: Drive with caution and be ready to stop

column2: 12. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.

column2: 13. What should you do if you see smoke come from under the hood?
column4: Call the fire department and then pull off the road and park your vehicle.
column6: Try to fight the fire yourself.
column8: Pull off the road and park your vehicle. Turn off the ignition, get away from the car and call the fire department.
column10: Jump off your car immediately, if it is safe to do so.

column2: 14. When a driver is turning and a pedestrian is crossing without a traffic light, __________ must yield the right-of-way.
column6: the pedestrian

column2: 15. Green and white signs:
column6: give information about directions and distances.
column8: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column10: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.

column2: 16. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they must turn either to the right or left.
column6: there is a winding road ahead.
column10: there is a double curve ahead.

column2: 17. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.
column6: steady red

column2: 18. Before entering a traffic circle, drivers must slow down and yield to ___________ in the traffic circle.
column6: vehicles

column2: 19. Which of the following may result in an arrest for driving under the influence of intoxicants (DUII)?
column4: An inhalant, such as glue or paint.
column6: A controlled substance, such as prescription medicines or illegal drugs.

column2: 20. This sign indicates:
column4: the maximum width of a vehicle allowed on the highway.
column6: the overpass ahead has a low clearance.
column10: the maximum legal height allowed in this State.

column2: 21. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column6: Before the stop line.

column2: 22. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Take a cold shower before driving.
column6: Drink coffee before driving.
column8: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column10: Stop drinking one hour before driving.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column4: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.
column6: No passing zone ahead.
column8: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.

column2: 24. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column6: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.

column2: 25. To pass a bicyclist traveling in the same direction on a two-lane road without bicycle lanes, you should:
column4: honk at the bicyclist to let him or her know you are about to pass.
column6: not pass the bicyclist until you come to a traffic signal or stop sign.
column8: slow down and wait until there is no oncoming traffic, then pass the bicyclist leaving him or her  sufficient space.
column10: continue driving straight, it is the bicyclist’s responsibility to get out of your way.

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column6: Side Road

column2: 27. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column6: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column10: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.

column2: 28. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column6: tailgating.

column2: 29. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column6: Diamond

column2: 30. If an aggressive driver is behind you:
column4: increase you speed and flash your brake lights.
column6: slow down and confront the aggressive driver.
column8: sound your horn and move to the left lane.
column10: try to get out of the aggressive driver’s way.

column2: 31. If traffic prevents you from crossing all the way across a set of railroad tracks:
column4: wait until the approaching train has come to a stop.
column6: proceed only when at least one-half of your vehicle can cross the tracks safely.
column8: wait until no trains are in sight.
column10: proceed only when there is room for your vehicle on the other side.

column2: 32. While driving you come upon a sign which says, “reduced speed 35 MPH”. You as a driver should know:
column4: that the new 35 MPH speed zone begins at this sign.
column6: that the sign is put there to harass “good” drivers.
column8: that the new 35 MPH speed zone begins at the next “speed limit” sign.
column10: that you have plenty of time to slow down before the speed zone.

column2: 33. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.
column6: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column8: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column10: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.

column2: 34. Diamond-shaped signs:
column6: typically provide guidance to drivers.
column8: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column6: Keep left

column2: 36. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column6: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column8: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column10: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.

column2: 37. This sign indicates:
column6: A slow-moving vehicle

column2: 38. Drugs may interfere with a person’s ability to drive safely:
column6: even if they are prescribed by a doctor.
column10: unless they are prescribed by a doctor.

column2: 39. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
column6: blue and white.

column2: 40. You want to turn left at an intersection ahead. A car reaches the intersection from the opposite direction and moves straight ahead. You:
column4: can turn left. You have the right of way.
column6: must make a U-turn and then turn right.
column8: must wait for the car to go through before you turn.
column10: may not enter the intersection to prepare for your left turn if the light is green.
